meanings.definition: To reduce to small particles by rubbing on a rough or sharp surface.
meanings.sent1: She grated the cheese for the pizza.
meanings.sent2: Mom grated some carrots for the salad.
meanings.sent3: The loud noise grated on my nerves.
meanings.sent4: The harsh wind grated against the window.
meanings.sent5: The metal grater grated the potato into tiny pieces.

meanings.sent1: His constant complaints grated on her patience.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive sound of the alarm grated on his ears.
meanings.sent3: The squeaky door grated on their nerves during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending construction noise grated on her sanity.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing mosquito grated on his peaceful evening.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh rasping sound.
meanings.sent1: The rusty gate grated as it opened slowly.
meanings.sent2: The old hinges grated loudly in the quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The chalk on the board grated as the teacher wrote.
meanings.sent4: The car brakes grated as they came to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent5: The metal chains grated against the concrete floor.
